intro: Dienia gmelinii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching a height of about 30 centimeters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Dienia gmelinii is popular as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
